events.name: DataFirst Launch Event – Experience new ways to put your data to work
events.description: On September 27, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics will come together and unveil the latest in cloud technology, enabling you to more efficiently put data to work. Experience how Spark, Hadoop, Python, and more are being used to bring together all types of data professionals –from data engineers, to data scientists, developers and business analysts –to work in new collaborative ways. The IBM DataFirst Launch Event will unite data and analytics leaders and practitioners from the open source community, startups, and enterprises. Check the event site for the latest lineup of guest speakers. The event takes place @ 6pm at the Hudson Mercantile Building, NYC. Here’s the plan:• The Big Reveal –Experience new ways to work for data engineers, data scientist, developers, and business analysts, both individually and collectively. •Hands-on sessions – With interactive experiences for each of these professions. •Use Cases –Community leaders and guest speakers will share their expertise and vision•Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks, data, collaborative demos, and a party on the rooftop Learn more here:  DataFirst Launch Event Check-in and networking begins at 6:00 PM.  Food and drinks will be served. You must register for this event. To get your ticket, and attend in person, click HERE.   Can't attend in person? We'll be live streaming this event.  Register for the LIVE STREAM and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.
events.location: Hudson Mercantile Bldg, 500 West 36th Street, Singapore

events.name: SG Geek Girls Reboot! Feat. Anthea Tang, GM, Rokkan Singapore
events.description:
It’s been a while since we’ve done a meetup and we’ve missed you! We’ve planned a special reboot meetup on 27th September at a brand new, swanky, co-working space in Orchard called Spacemob and we hope you can join us! Upcoming SG Geek Girls Meetup featuring Anthea Tang, GM, Rokkan Singapore  In this meetup, we’re happy to have Anthea Tang, GM of Rokkan Singapore to share about her journey with the many sides of tech. Details: Tuesday, 27 Sep, 2016, 7- 8.30pm @ Spacemob #03-01, 8 Claymore Hill, Singapore 229572 Speaker #1: Anthea Tang, GM, Rokkan Singapore From a degree in industrial engineering, to working on optimizing public transport through software, and now being MD of a digital creative agency, Anthea will be sharing her journey with the many sides of technology and how a background in tech gave her a headstart in her career. 

Speaker #2: Roopal Kondepudi Roopal is (was) the youngest attendee of our first SG Geek Girls workshop back in 2012! 4 years on, she’s come a long way from our HTML and CSS workshop. Roopal will share about the apps she’s been working on (FloraSG) and her experience setting up a Geek Girls chapter in her school! P.S. All are welcome to join! If you're a guy, please do bring a female friend along!   BIG thank you to our venue sponsor:   spacemob.co Spacemob is a coworking space that builds foundations for businesses by providing space, technology, and connections. By laying down the groundwork, companies can thrive with purpose. With their space as the starting point, Spacemob is endlessly building proprietary tools like with member matching technologies to enable you to augment your business, and scale it to the heights of your imagination. And also to O'Reilly for sponsoring some very cool swag!   We'll be giving away books about data science sponsored by O'Reilly, they're having a cool Strata + Hadoop World conference in December at Suntec - you should check it out!

events.name: Trending in Tech
events.description:
RSVP for free here: http://mis-trendingintech.peatix.com

Speakers:

Roshni Mahtani (CEO, Founder of Tickled Media)
Lai Chang Wen (CEO, Ninja Van)
Derek Tan (Co-founder, Viddsee)

A panel of trailblazers from tech companies in Singapore will talk about their perspectives on building their startups in Singapore and expanding regionally. You’ll hear from founders about how products and services can change a traditional industry, their experience starting up and their vision for Singapore's startup future.
events.location: General Assembly Singapore, 1 Keong Saik Road 089101

events.name: HHSG SEPT 27: Building self-updating visualisations with Yong Jun
events.description: Yong Jun will take us through the learnings and insights from his journey building the HDB Resale Prices Project.  Especially useful for those who'd like to know how to deal with big datasets and build real-time, auto updating graphics. Yong Jun will also share some UX features that will help make those big data visualisations easier to understand. It will be held at the Microsoft Boardroom and we are very grateful they have allowed us to return - please do bring along your ID to exchange for passes. Of course, if you would like to talk or share anything at all, please don't hesitate to get in touch with us [masked].
events.location: Microsoft Singapore - 22BR-01, 1 Marina Boulevard #22-01 One Marina Boulevard Singapore 018989
